title: A Child of the Paris Streets

sources.title: "A Child of the Paris Streets" (1916) starring Mae Marsh and Robert Harron
sources.description: This gem is presented by Silent Hall of Fame.   Please visit https://silent-hall-of-fame.org/   to support our non-profit mission and the legacy of silent movie stars by making a tax deductible contribution.   FEEL FREE TO FOLLOW US ON TWITTER @SilentFilmGems     This is a short preview. You can watch the whole film here: https://silent-hall-of-fame.org/index.php/gems-for-donation   "A Child of the Paris Streets" is a crime drama, included in our program to illustrate the work of Robert Harron, a star of Silent Hall of Fame.  After a guilty verdict the convict's mother plans a revenge against the judge and his family.  Directed by               Lloyd Ingraham Produced by             The Fine Arts Film Company Scenario by                Grant Carpenter          Starring                     Mae Marsh, Robert Harron, Jennie Lee, Carl Stockdale, Tully Marshall Distributed by           Triangle Film Corporation Release date               May 21, 1916 Running time             43 min. Country                      United States Language                    Silent film, English intertitles   Copyright Disclaimer Under Section 107 of the Copyright Act 1976: "Allowance is made for "fair use" for purposes such as criticism, comment, news reporting, teaching, scholarship, and research. Fair use is a use permitted by copyright statute that might otherwise be infringing. Non-profit, educational or personal use tips the balance in favor of fair use."

metadata.Plot: When the son of a leader of a Paris underworld family known as The Apaches is arrested and tried in court, the boy's mother asks the judge for mercy, but he refuses. In retaliation, the family kidnaps the judge's young daughter, and raises her to be one of their own, schooling her in the ways of crime. One day she steals a valuable pin from a young American artist; he catches her, but an attraction develops between them--and her "Apache" family is not happy about it.
metadata.Actors: Mae Marsh, Robert Harron, Jennie Lee
